cards.q: Name some of the benefits of Java
cards.a: Object oriented, encapsulation, memory management (less prone to memory leaks), huge library, secure by design (jvm sandbox), write once run anywhere, strongly typed, multithreaded, distributed computing

cards.q: These are valid identifiers true or false: $objectOne, 1$objectTwo, _Object3
cards.a: false, identifiers can begin with letter, currency character or connecting character like underscore, but not a digit

cards.q: These are valid identifiers true or false: $ObjectOne, _ObjectTwo, someObject3, someOtherObject$$99
cards.a: true, identifiers can begin with letter, currency character or connecting character like underscore, but not a digit

cards.q: T/F : There can be only one public class per source file?
T/F: Classes can be made private?
if there is a public class does the file name have to match True/False
Files can contain multiple classes true/false
package name has to be first line if file is in a package t/f
T/F Multiple classes in one file can have their own package and imports?
cards.a: false, each file can only have 1 unique package and set of imports
